EmailTooltester is supported by readers like yourself. We may earn a commission when you purchase through our links. Of course, this won't increase the cost for you.

In recent years, [MailerLite](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/mailerlite/) has become the go-to email marketing service for businesses looking to get their email marketing efforts up and running while sticking to a tight budget.

In fact, MailerLite is a tool we’ve repeatedly awarded for its **ease of use, value for money, and excellent deliverability rates**. And if you think as highly of the tool as we do, you may feel as though MailerLite is hard to beat.

Despite this, we can’t deny that it **still lacks some advanced features found in other email marketing services** – often at a similar cost.

With this in mind, let’s delve deeper into top-notch MailerLite alternatives that might be better matched to your specific needs. Whether you're an email marketing novice or a seasoned pro, understanding what’s out there can help you make a more informed choice.

*   [MailerLite Alternatives: Conclusion](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/mailerlite-alternatives/#MailerLite_Alternatives_Conclusion "MailerLite Alternatives: Conclusion")

MailerLite’s Biggest Drawbacks
------------------------------

Here are the main reasons why MailerLite might not be right for you:

**Missing Some Pro Features:**

“You get what you pay for” rings particularly true here. Even with its [competitive pricing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/mailerlite/pricing/) (which starts at $15/month for 500 contacts on the Growing Business plan), MailerLite users miss out on several premium features. The absence of full reporting, CRM capabilities, and spam/design testing can sometimes leave more advanced marketers wanting more.

**Rigorous Approval Process:**

High deliverability rates are a must in email marketing, and MailerLite’s stringent approval process no doubt contributes to its [strong performance in deliverability](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/email-deliverability-test/). However, the approval period (which can take up to 24 hours) might come off as excessive to those eager to jump in and get started.

**Template Limitations:**

If you're using the [free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/free-email-marketing-services/) version of MailerLite, be prepared to craft your emails from scratch. Access to newsletter and landing page templates is exclusive to paid users. And if you're keen on using the HTML editor, you'll need to be on the pricier Advanced plan, which starts at $20/month for 500 subscribers.

**Subscriber Management:**

MailerLite keeps it basic. While it does cover essential ground, the platform doesn't offer advanced subscriber management tools, with limited options for creating segments based on behavior. It also lacks an extensive [tagging](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-tagging/) system to help businesses categorize subscribers more flexibly, using a more rigid “Groups” structure instead.

**Automation Gaps:**

The beauty of email marketing lies in automation, and while MailerLite does offer automated workflows for standard triggers, it stops short of more advanced ones. For instance, the inability to set automations based on page visits can be a major shortcoming for users who are serious about implementing a [marketing automation strategy](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/marketing-automation-strategy/).

With that in mind, let’s take a look at the MailerLite alternatives that could better serve your needs.

### 1\. Brevo![Image 2: brevo homepage](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/brevo-homepage-e1691156638701.png)

While MailerLite does email campaigns really well, [Brevo (formerly Sendinblue)](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/brevo/) turns it up a notch. With a slick automation workflow designer, Brevo lets you craft campaigns triggered not just by opens and clicks, but even by visits to your website. What’s more, it also allows you to send [transactional emails](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/transactional-email-examples/) such as password resets, purchase confirmations, and more. With MailerLite, you need an add-on service (MailerSend) for this.

Brevo also offers advanced features such as SMS and WhatsApp campaigns. And for those on the higher-tier Business plan? A/B testing, landing pages, Facebook ads, and more are all in the mix.

Pricing is where things really get interesting. While MailerLite charges based on your subscriber count, Brevo takes a different route, charging primarily per email instead (with generous limits for list sizes). This can save you money if your list is relatively large but you don't email them very frequently. And if you only send the occasional newsletter, Brevo offers a useful pay-as-you-go option.

#### Brevo video review:

![Image 3: brevo video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-40995-1.jpg)

#### Where Brevo beats MailerLite:

Brevo’s free plan generally gives you more than MailerLite. For example, you won’t have access to newsletter or landing page templates on MailerLite’s free plan, which is a pretty big limitation.

If you need advanced features like SMS marketing, live chat, or sales CRM functionalities, MailerLite doesn't provide these capabilities like Brevo does. It also requires you to subscribe to its separate MailerSend service for transactional emails.

Price-wise, we find Brevo to be more competitive, especially if you’re working with larger lists. Brevo’s prices start at $9/month. You can compare Brevo and MailerLite’s costs using our [email marketing cost calculator](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/email-marketing-cost/).

#### Where MailerLite wins:

Among all the email marketing software we've evaluated, MailerLite stands out for its exceptional email deliverability. Recently, Brevo's deliverability performance has seen a decline, which is obviously not ideal if you’re sending regular campaigns.

Another big difference is that MailerLite users can sell digital products, including subscriptions, directly from the platform. This is a feature that Brevo currently doesn't offer.

#### When we’d recommend Brevo:

When stacked up against MailerLite, Brevo shines for those with a hefty contact list but who aren't hitting “Send” all that often. If you're on the hunt for a tool that offers great bang for your buck, with perks like CRM, SMS, and live chat, then Brevo is definitely worth a closer look.

**[\> Try Brevo for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sendinblue)**

### 2\. Sender

[![Image 4: sender](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/sender.net_.png)](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sender)

[Sender](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sender) is an excellent alternative to MailerLite, especially if you're on a budget and looking for an email platform that offers a generous free plan. The Free Forever plan offers unlimited automation, 24/7 chat support, and you can send 15,000 monthly emails to up to 2,500 subscribers.

Thanks to the drag-and-drop email builder and a wide selection of responsive templates, you can create these emails in minutes. You can also save time by picking a pre-made automated workflow template and quickly creating emails like welcome sequences, abandoned cart reminders, and thank-you notes.

As your business scales, you can enhance your campaigns with powerful SMS features, audience segmentation, and popups to capture leads more effectively. Real-time reporting and a newsletter heatmap provide instant insights into what’s working and what needs tweaking.

#### Where Sender beats MailerLite:

Even on the free plan, you’ll have access to customer service round the clock, something that MailerLite doesn't offer. For MailerLite, priority support is for paid plan users only.

In addition, Sender’s automation tools are robust, allowing you to set up unlimited automated workflows, even on the free tier. This is ideal for businesses on a budget that are looking to save time and streamline their email marketing processes.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

MailerLite stands out with its additional advanced features, like a website builder and [landing page creator](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/free-landing-page/) — tools that Sender currently doesn’t offer. These features make MailerLite a more comprehensive platform if you want to create a website and manage your email marketing campaigns in one place.

#### When we’d recommend Sender:

Sender is perfect for marketers who are just getting started or those who want an easy-to-use email marketing platform without sacrificing powerful automation tools. In short, it's your go-to option if you want a platform that offers a generous free plan with unlimited email automation, responsive templates, and excellent customer service.

[\> Try Sender for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sender)

### 3\. Moosend

![Image 5: moosend homepage](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/moosend-homepage-e1691156721868.png)

This is an obvious one and one of the best alternatives. The two share many similarities, especially when it comes to their easy-to-use drag-and-drop editors. But what really stands out for [Moosend](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/moosend/) is its affordable pricing, which starts at $9/month – and includes unlimited emails, plus automations, transactional emails, and landing pages.

But it doesn't stop there. You've got the power to A/B test subject lines, as well as insert email countdown timers to ramp up urgency. Another bonus is the ability to directly drop comments and feedback on designs within the tool, which is a feature you won’t readily find in other email marketing services.

Its automations are also impressive, with an intuitive automation builder, and a wide range of templates to start from (e.g. abandoned carts campaigns, upsell emails, anniversary flows).

#### Where Moosend beats MailerLite:

Moosend comes with a handy feature for free spam and design testing. This checks if your email can dodge the spam filters across big-name email clients and even gives you tips to improve your design. With MailerLite, you can sneak a peek at how your design looks on desktop and mobile but you can’t view it across various email clients or test for spam.

Moosend also comes out stronger in terms of automations, with a solid range of “recipes” to get started with, and the option to trigger automations based on website/product views (which is not available with MailerLite).

#### Where MailerLite wins:

Moosend recently removed its free plan, so if you were hoping to use Moosend for free, it’s sadly not an option (as it is with MailerLite). However, it does offer a free 30-day trial to let you test the platform out.

We also found Moosend’s selection of [signup forms](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/newsletter-sign-up-examples/) and email templates to be more limited than MailerLite’s. And its deliverability rates were average, lagging behind MailerLite’s.

#### When we’d recommend Moosend:

Moosend’s pricing is extremely competitive and comes with a stack of useful extras, so anyone looking for a budget-friendly yet versatile tool should seriously consider Moosend.

**[\> Try Moosend for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/moosend)**

### 4\. GetResponse

![Image 6: getresponse cheap email marketing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/getresponse-cheap-email-marketing-e1693485540470.png)

[GetResponse](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/getresponse/) offers a wide selection of features, including the ability to host your own webinars – something we haven’t found in any other email marketing service! Yet, it avoids overwhelming users with a steep learning curve. In fact, it's remarkably user-friendly.

The email service provider boasts an intuitive drag-and-drop email builder, allowing you to infuse your branding, fonts, colors, and media.

Despite being at the [pricier](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/getresponse/pricing/) end of the spectrum, GetResponse justifies its cost with a comprehensive library of pre-built automations. These cover everything from winback campaigns and welcome sequences to post-purchase retargeting and loyalty campaigns, all of which can be customized to fit your specific needs.

It's a powerful tool that manages to balance complexity with accessibility, making it a strong choice for those looking to create sophisticated campaigns without the headaches.

#### GetResponse video review:

![Image 7: getresponse video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-40959-1.jpg)

#### Where GetResponse beats MailerLite:

On paper, both offer a similar feature range, including landing pages, a [website builder](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/best-website-builder-with-email-marketing/), the ability to sell products, and AI assistant. But GetResponse takes it even further, with additional features such as webinars, live chat widgets, and [sales funnels](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/sales-funnel-software/) (note that most of these require GetResponse’s higher-level plans).

GetResponse’s reporting and contact management features are also stronger than MailerLite’s. For example, GetResponse lets you add a wide range of conditions to segment your subscriber list automatically. It also allows you to deep dive into everything from contact data, to newsletter and automation performance.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

To access additional automations and advanced segmentation with GetResponse, you’ll need to upgrade from the affordable Email Marketing plan (from $19/month) to the Marketing Automation plan – and there is a significant jump in cost.

It’s also not so budget-friendly for ecommerce owners – features such as ecommerce tracking and abandoned cart emails require the _very_ pricey Ecommerce Marketing plan (starting at around $100/month).

Finally, our testing has revealed that the deliverability rates are much lower compared to MailerLite.

#### When we’d recommend GetResponse:

GetResponse is ideal for sales-driven small and medium-sized businesses in search of a comprehensive marketing tool. With its blend of advanced automations, sales funnel tools, CRM, and an integrated webinar solution, it offers great value considering the array of features available.

**[\> Try GetResponse for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/getresponse)**

### 5\. SendPulse

![Image 8: sendpulse cheap email marketing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/sendpulse-cheap-email-marketing-e1693485336927.png)

SendPulse provides a complete marketing ecosystem, including an affordable email marketing software that lets users craft attractive branded emails. One noteworthy feature is its built-in spam checker, which can help you steer clear of blacklists and [boost deliverability](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-deliverability-best-practices/).

With SendPulse, you can send [automated emails](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/automated-email-examples/) such as welcome emails, abandoned cart reminders, and notifications based on user behavior. As your business evolves, you can add on extras such as [chatbots](https://www.tooltester.com/en/blog/best-ai-chatbot/), web push notifications, and SMS campaigns to align with your needs.

Features like email marketing, transactional emails, sales CRM, landing pages, chatbots, and more are included with SendPulse’s generous free plan, which lets you send 15,000 marketing emails to 500 subscribers monthly.

#### Where SendPulse beats MailerLite:

With SendPulse, you get a full marketing platform for sending marketing emails, SMSes, web push notifications, chatbots, and more. You’ll miss out on many of these features with MailerLite.

In addition to marketing emails, the free plan also gives you a generous allowance of 12,000 transactional emails per month. MailerLite’s transactional email service only allows for 3,000 free emails per month.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

We find MailerLite’s interface to be easier to navigate than SendPulse, with SendPulse’s editor at times buggy and slow. Automations are also much easier to set up with MailerLite as SendPulse’s autoresponder editor isn’t very intuitive.

In terms of transactional emails, we also found MailerLite’s MailerSend service to hit much higher [deliverability](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/free-smtp-servers/#Deliverability_Scores) rates than SendPulse.

#### When we’d recommend SendPulse:

Opt for SendPulse if you're seeking the robust features and capabilities usually found in pricey email marketing tools but without the hefty cost. What makes SendPulse stand out is its adaptability; it grows with you, allowing you to incorporate more channels as your business scales. If you have ambitious goals, SendPulse is a solid choice.

**[\> Try SendPulse out for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sendpulse)**

### 6\. Omnisend

![Image 9: omnisend cheap email marketing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/omnisend-cheap-email-marketing-e1693485436351.png)

[Omnisend](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/omnisend/) is our top pick if you’re running an online store. Its wide range of ecommerce automations (including [abandoned cart sequences](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/abandoned-cart-templates/), order confirmations, and back-in-stock reminders), and niche ecommerce features makes it one of the [best email marketing solutions for ecommerce](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/best-email-marketing-for-ecommerce/).

By “niche features”, we mean a wheel of fortune form to incentivize sign-ups, interactive gift boxes, automated product recommendations, and live view website tracking – which you definitely won’t find in most email marketing services (and certainly not in MailerLite!).

With Omnisend, you can even incorporate push notifications and SMS automations into your campaigns, making it an ideal option for [omnichannel marketing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/omnichannel-software/).

#### Omnisend video review:

![Image 10: omnisend video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-41001-1.jpg)

#### Where Omnisend beats MailerLite:

There’s no doubt that Omnisend is much stronger in the ecommerce game. It integrates with more ecommerce platforms (including OpenCart and BigCommerce), and as we mentioned before, offers interesting features to help store owners boost email sales.

With Omnisend, you can also segment new subscribers based on specific details (e.g. customers who purchased a specific product), which can help you [target](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/targeted-email-marketing/) your emails better.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

While you do get access to email templates on Omnisend’s free plan (which you don’t with MailerLite), its template range is pretty limited. Its designs also aren’t as eye-catching as MailerLite’s.

Deliverability also doesn’t seem to be one of Omnisend’s strong points, as we discovered in our tests. MailerLite has a much better track record in this regard.

#### When we’d recommend Omnisend:

Price-wise, Omnisend comes out [slightly higher](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/omnisend/pricing/) than MailerLite – but it’s worth it if you run an online store. Omnisend’s wider range of ecommerce integrations, automations, and email features can make a huge difference in driving sales from your email campaigns.

**[\> Try Omnisend for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/omnisend)**

### 7\. ActiveCampaign

![Image 11: activecampaign for agencies](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/activecampaign-for-agencies-e1693485505665.png)

If you find MailerLite’s automations too basic, you’ll want to check out [ActiveCampaign](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/activecampaign/). With ActiveCampaign, you gain the power to automate responses based on your website visitors' behavior, employing intricate if/when/then logic. In our view, it’s one of the best platforms for automation and contact segmentation.

This also extends to its comprehensive [CRM](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/crm/activecampaign-review/) (available as an add-on product), which simplifies the management of sales directly from the backend, and allows you to better target ‘at risk’ or ‘hot’ leads.

Embracing the growing trend around AI, ActiveCampaign has also introduced a content generator that leverages the [GPT](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/creating-a-newsletter-with-chatgpt/) engine, which can help you [write newsletters](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/how-to-write-a-newsletter/) with very little effort.

#### ActiveCampaign video review:

![Image 12: activecampaign video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-40983-1.jpg)

#### Where ActiveCampaign beats MailerLite:

ActiveCampaign stands out with its advanced automation features, surpassing the capabilities of most of the email marketing software we’ve reviewed here. With around 900 workflows to start from, there’s virtually no limit to the [sales](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/crm-with-automation/) and marketing processes you can automate.

ActiveCampaign also offers more sophisticated reporting than MailerLite, with deeper insights into email performance, behavioral data, and deal pipelines.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

With such an extensive range of features, it’s no surprise that ActiveCampaign is the more expensive option, with [plans](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/activecampaign/pricing/) starting at $19 plan (no free plan is available).

MailerLite is also the more beginner-friendly email marketing platform, with a more intuitive backend and a shallower learning curve than ActiveCampaign. Read more about [MailerLite vs ActiveCampaign](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/mailerlite-vs-activecampaign/) in our complete guide.

#### When we’d recommend ActiveCampaign:

ActiveCampaign is an especially good fit for power users such as ecommerce stores and B2B companies looking to optimize their lead generation process through the integrated CRM. Additionally, [marketing agencies](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-marketing-software-for-agencies/) might find ActiveCampaign's white labeling features particularly useful.

**[\> Try ActiveCampaign for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/activecampaign)**

### 8\. Mailjet

![Image 13: mailjet cheap email marketing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/mailjet-cheap-email-marketing-e1693485394848.png)

[Mailjet](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/mailjet/) is geared towards collaborative email marketing, particularly for small teams. Its standout collaboration feature allows entire teams to work on an email in real time. Coupled with a wide range of features (including SMS marketing), Mailjet presents a versatile and collaboration-friendly alternative to MailerLite.

What sets Mailjet apart further is its integration of email marketing with email API services, all in one platform. In fact, most of Mailjet’s [transactional email](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/best-transactional-email-service/) features are available right off the bat on its free plan, which lets you send up to 6,000 emails a month.

While Mailjet is an affordable email marketing software, be mindful that costs can escalate if you require advanced features like automations, [A/B testing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-ab-testing/), and [dynamic content](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/dynamic-content-in-emails/).

#### Where Mailjet beats MailerLite:

It’s hard to beat [Mailjet’s competitive pricing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/mailjet/pricing/) for basic email campaigns. Unlike MailerLite, Mailjet charges based on monthly email sends rather than list size. If you have a large list but don’t plan to send more than 15,000 emails per month, the Premium plan will cost you just $15/month. (By comparison, a monthly subscription to MailerLite for 15,000 contacts will cost you close to $100/month!)

Its real-time collaboration is also a novel concept in email marketing (picture the collaborative capabilities of Google Docs but in an email editor). Team members can comment and lock sections to prevent simultaneous edits by others, while the campaign approval process allows managers to have the final say and sign off on campaigns.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

Compared to MailerLite, Mailjet’s segmentation conditions are more restrictive, with only basic filtering conditions available, and limited filters for email engagement. In general, we found [list management](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-list-management/) to be more user-friendly with MailerLite. For example, while MailerLite automatically unsubscribes hard bounces, Mailjet makes this a manual task.

We also found the automation conditions a bit too limited, lacking conditions like ‘if opened/unopened'. It’s a big drawback that you can't edit workflows once activated, or reactivate an inactive workflow.

MailerLite’s landing page and website builder also make it the more comprehensive platform if you’re looking to run [lead generation](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-marketing-lead-generation/) campaigns.

#### When we’d recommend Mailjet:

Mailjet caters to small teams seeking a collaborative approach (for example, agency users), and is also well-suited for less-technical users, thanks to its no-code templates. It’s also a strong option for sending transactional emails. If you value seamless integration, Mailjet's wide range of integrations with ecommerce platforms, CRMs, and social media, will be particularly appealing.

**[\> Try Mailjet for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/mailjet)**

### 9\. MailChimp

![Image 14: mailchimp homepage](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/mailchimp-homepage-e1691156676201.png)

This email marketing giant hardly needs an introduction. It’s MailerLite’s biggest competitor, with both sharing similar reputations as user-friendly marketing tools for small-to-medium businesses.

But there are a few reasons why [MailChimp](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/mailchimp/) is not as high on this list as you might expect. The biggest one is [price](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/mailchimp/pricing/), with MailChimp charging between 20-50% more than MailerLite for similar-sized subscriber lists. We also find that subscriber management can get complicated with MailChimp (as you’ll see in a second).

Still, MailChimp does have its strengths. It offers a much wider range of automations than MailerLite, including advanced ecommerce flows. And its reporting features are also more comprehensive, with the ability to track activity from social media (which isn’t available with MailerLite).

#### MailChimp video review:

![Image 15: mailchimp video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-41007-1.jpg)

#### Where MailChimp beats MailerLite:

While MailerLite provides basic reporting and ecommerce tracking for Shopify and [WooCommerce](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/best-email-marketing-for-woocommerce/), it lacks social media tracking and information on email clients. MailChimp lets you pull in data from a wider range of ecommerce platforms (including Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce, WooCommerce, PrestaShop, and more) and includes social media and email client data.

Another bonus with Mailchimp is that you can preview how your email will look on various email clients, with 25 Inbox Preview tokens to use every month (on paid plans).

#### Where MailerLite wins:

Aside from the more affordable price tag for paid plans, MailerLite’s free plan allows for 1,000 subscribers and 12,000 monthly emails, which is much more generous than Mailchimp's 500 subscribers and 1,000-email limit. You also won’t be charged for unsubscribed or bounced contacts, as you would with MailChimp.

Features-wise, MailerLite offers a more user-friendly approach to list management, allowing segmentation and automation for moving subscribers between groups and charging for subscribers only once regardless of the number of groups or segments they belong to.

MailChimp also isn’t appropriate if you’re an affiliate marketer, as this is an industry that’s prohibited in its Terms of Use.

#### When we’d recommend MailChimp:

MailChimp makes more sense if having a wider range of integrations is important to you, and if you need more comprehensive reporting. Also, check out our [MailerLite vs MailChimp](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/mailerlite-vs-mailchimp) guide for a more detailed look into how they compare.

**[\> Try MailChimp for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/mailchimp-email-services)**

### 10\. Constant Contact

### ![Image 16: constant contact](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/constant-contact-homepage.png)

[Constant Contact](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/constant-contact/) is another big name in email marketing, having been around since 1995. It remains relatively popular, although its outdated editor and backend make it seem like a dinosaur compared to the email service providers on this list – and a more expensive one at that.

Still, it offers a few features that are niche in the industry. These include the ability to manage event invitations, registrations, and tickets (via their Eventbrite integration), plus social media scheduling, logo creation, and digital product selling.

It also provides integrations with thousands of apps and consistently performs well in our deliverability tests.

#### Constant Contact video review:

![Image 17: constant contact video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-41031-1.jpg)

#### Where Constant Contact beats MailerLite:

If you run regular events, Constant Contact’s event management features can help you streamline the invitation and registration process. Bear in mind that this feature comes at a cost: 5.4% + $0.80 for each ticket sold or transaction conducted.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

Constant Contact's autoresponders are fairly basic, offering only welcome and anniversary emails, along with triggered automations based on opens and clicks.

The email templates look a bit dated, and registration forms are also basic, with no option to add custom fields.

We’ve found that MailerLite’s customer support tends to be easier to reach. Lastly, considering the lack of advanced features, [Constant Contact's pricing](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/constant-contact/pricing/) (which starts at $50 for a small list of 2,500 contacts), is not as competitive as MailerLite’s.

#### When we’d recommend Constant Contact:

While Constant Contact is a much pricier tool than MailerLite (with little to justify this premium), it’s an interesting option if you run regular events and want to manage invitations and registrations within a single platform.

[**\> Try Constant Contact for free**](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/constant-contact-cta)

### 11\. Kit

![Image 18: convertkit free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/convertkit-free.png)

Designed to serve the unique needs of [bloggers](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/email-marketing-for-bloggers/) and creators, [Kit](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/convertkit/) offers a range of features that go beyond simple email marketing. From crafting beautiful email campaigns to visual automations to setting up intricate “if this, then that” sequences, the email marketing software also allows for advanced subscriber segmentation options and even direct product sales.

What stands out is the Creator Network feature, which helps you grow your audience through partnerships with other creators. While Kit’s forms and landing pages may be basic, they are incredibly user-friendly and compatible with all major blogging platforms.

Another interesting feature is the ability to convert your emails into web pages and monetize access to them, a particularly useful function if you offer [paid newsletters](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/how-to-monetize-a-newsletter/).

#### Kit video review:

![Image 19: convertkit video review](https://www.emailtooltester.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/video-banner-41025-1.jpg)

#### Where Kit beats MailerLite:

Kit lets you easily set up email sequences and build out visual workflows for automation. What's especially useful is the tagging feature, which lets you tailor your messages based on actions like link clicks or form submissions. It’s also handy for sending targeted emails to specific groups, e.g. new vs. repeat customers. Doing something similar with MailerLite takes a bit more effort (using “groups” rather than “tags”).

The Creator Network is also a unique feature that can help to grow your newsletter’s audience through cross-promotion and recommendations.

#### Where MailerLite wins:

[Kit’s pricing plans](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/reviews/convertkit/pricing/) are on the higher side, particularly when stacked against more feature-rich services like MailerLite.

The email design choices are also limited, with a scant selection of templates. And the landing page editor leaves a lot to be desired in terms of user-friendliness and template quality.

You can read more in our [MailerLite vs Kit](https://www.emailtooltester.com/en/blog/mailerlite-vs-convertkit/) comparison.

#### Where we’d recommend Kit:

Kit is recommended for marketers and creators who want to run highly targeted automated campaigns, thanks to its robust tagging and segmentation features. It's also ideal for those looking to manage their entire campaign, including landing pages, within a single platform. If you're a creative professional aiming to sell digital products or subscriptions, Kit's unique and easy-to-use digital selling feature—available even on the free plan—makes it a compelling choice.

**[\> Try Kit for free](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/convertkit)**

MailerLite Alternatives: Conclusion
-----------------------------------

While MailerLite offers a wide range of features and excellent value for money, it does fall short in some areas – especially where advanced functionalities are concerned.

*   If you're on a **budget** but still want to harness the power of email marketing, consider cheaper options like [Brevo](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sendinblue), [Sender](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sender), [Moosend](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/moosend), and [SendPulse](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/sendpulse).
*   For those in need of more sophisticated **automations**, [ActiveCampaign](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/activecampaign) and [GetResponse](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/getresponse) lead the pack.
*   When it comes to **transactional emails**, all-in-one services like Brevo, SendPulse, and [Mailjet](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/mailjet) are better options.
*   **Ecommerce businesses** should turn to [Omnisend](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/omnisend) or [Mailchimp](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/mailchimp-email-services) for a wider range of ecommerce integrations and specialized features.

*   Lastly, **content creators** could benefit from [Kit's](https://www.emailtooltester.com/out/convertkit) tailored offerings and Creator Network.

With these MailerLite alternatives, you're bound to find a service that matches your specific needs – so if any of these have caught your attention, we’d encourage you to try them out for free.

Constant Contact supports over 500 marketing integrations, and you can connect it to everything from social media and event apps to business management and CRM software. **Because it has such a great balance between built-in tools and external integrations, I think Constant Contact would work well for teams that need an all-in-one marketing platform.**

Like MailerLite, Constant Contact prices its plans based on list size. However, **Constant Contact doesn’t have a free plan, and its lowest-priced plan is one of the more expensive options of its kind on the market** (although it does have a generous **60-day free trial** if you’re based in the US – 30 days for everyone else). If you’re on a budget, I would recommend a platform with a free plan, such as **AWeber free plan**.

Constant Contact’s marketing calendar supports email, social media, ads, and landing pages

With Constant Contact, you get:

*   **E-commerce tools:** Most email marketing platforms have e-commerce integrations, but few have built-in solutions. **Constant Contact has an e-commerce tool that lets you sell unlimited items, including digital products and downloads.** With a payment processor, a shipping manager, and an inventory tool, this platform has everything you need to sell online.
*   **Social media ads and scheduling:** Although MailerLite has basic Facebook integrations, it doesn’t offer ads or organic posting. Constant Contact supports paid Facebook and Instagram ads and lets you schedule organic social media posts. This feature is ideal for marketers who manage both email and social media.
*   **Better website builder:** MailerLite has a website builder, but you have to pay extra for a website with more than five landing pages. In contrast, **Constant Contact lets you build a mobile-responsive site with a blog, analytics, and free hosting**. With this platform, you can create as many landing pages as you need, including shoppable pages and lead generation forms.
*   **Marketing calendar:** To help you keep your email and social media campaigns straight, Constant Contact has a convenient marketing calendar. This visualization lets you create drafts or complete campaigns, and it can help you feel confident that you’ve timed every element perfectly.

[6\. AWeber – Offers the Best Support for Marketing Teams](https://www.websiteplanet.com/goto.php?id=2127&lang=en&deep_id=0&deep_name=&btn_name=VendorExternalUrl_2127_post_1855439_280349&post_id=1855439&pageview_id=0&direct_link=&type=post&amp=0)

**With its large email template library and extensive app integration options, AWeber has much more functionality than MailerLite.** AWeber also has a built-in e-commerce tool and offers more landing pages with every pricing tier. Although both MailerLite and AWeber have free plans, I find the latter superior. **AWeber’s free plan supports up to 500 subscribers and includes hundreds of email templates, an e-commerce solution, and as many landing pages as you need to create.** By going with AWeber, you could sell products and grow your list at no cost.

All AWeber plans allow unlimited users and offer some of the most accessible customer support available anywhere, making this plan a great choice for beginners. But if you’re an experienced marketer or if your team has more complex marketing needs, I would recommend a platform like [GetResponse](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/getresponse/) or [ActiveCampaign](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/activecampaign/) instead.

When MailerLite Isn’t for You
-----------------------------

MailerLite offers email marketing essentials like responsive templates, a drag-and-drop editor, A/B testing, and audience segmentation. It also has a free plan that lets you send up to 12,000 emails per month. **But with its limited automations, lack of built-in tools, and a short list of app integrations, MailerLite isn’t the best option for every marketer.**

If you’re looking for a MailerLite alternative with more email templates and app integrations, go with **Benchmark** or **AWeber**, which both have hundreds of options. **To automate your marketing efforts, consider GetResponse or ActiveCampaign, which have the most powerful marketing automations.**

For native tools, **go with Constant Contact**, which serves as a complete marketing suite. **If you want an email marketing service for less, consider Sendinblue’s generous free plan, which provides the widest range of marketing tools at no cost.** To browse other MailerLite competitors, look at our list of the [top email marketing services in 2024](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/).

FAQ

### Is MailerLite better than Mailchimp?

MailerLite is better than Mailchimp, whether you choose a free plan or a paid account. With a paid plan, [MailerLite offers advanced features](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/mailerlite/) that Mailchimp doesn’t have, including a dedicated IP that offers more control over deliverability.

MailerLite has a free plan, so you can use this service at no cost. If you want to send unlimited emails or advanced features, choose a paid plan instead. MailerLite’s premium plans start at $10.00 per month for up to 1,000 subscribers. Pricing increases based on the size of your subscriber list.

### How do I delete my MailerLite account?

You can delete your MailerLite account from the login screen. First, enter your username and password. Then locate the account you want to delete and click the gear icon to access settings. Select “Delete account” to complete the process. If other users still need access to the account, click “Remove me from this account” instead. Once you’ve removed your account, [try out one of the MailerLite alternatives on this list](https://www.websiteplanet.com/blog/best-mailerlite-alternatives/#activecampaign).

You can delete your MailerLite account from the login screen with a couple clicks

### What are the best alternatives to MailerLite?

Whether you’re a business owner who needs an automation platform for rapid growth or a blogger or freelancer who needs a simple tool for email marketing, there are far better alternatives to MailerLite. I would personally recommend [ActiveCampaign](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/activecampaign/) or [GetResponse](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/getresponse/). Check out our review of the **[best email marketing services in 2024](https://www.websiteplanet.com/email-marketing-services/)** to find the right option for your needs.

analyzed_content.content:
Social media, artificial intelligence, video marketing, and more — there’s a growing list of digital marketing methods at marketers’ disposal.

Yet email marketing remains a tried-and-true method for capturing leads and moving them through the funnel. With an average return on investment of [$36 for every $1 spent](https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-stats), email marketing is a low-cost medium with the potential for huge rewards.

Email newsletters like Marketer Milk’s can be particularly effective at building trust with your audience and growing a loyal community around your brand. Over the years, such newsletters have grown more sophisticated with the addition of [newsletter platforms](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/best-newsletter-platforms) that automate and streamline the process of capturing and converting leads. Combining email design, customer relationship management (CRM), automation, and other email marketing features, today’s email marketing platforms are indispensable tools in email marketers’ toolkits.

[MailerLite](https://www.mailerlite.com/) is one popular platform, offering robust features at an affordable price point. However, there are many MailerLite alternatives to consider as you research your options for creating and distributing an email newsletter. Below, we offer 10 other MailerLite alternatives worth exploring, complete with notable features, use cases, pricing, and reviews. Let’s get started — so you can get started on your newsletter creation.

What to look for in MailerLite alternatives
-------------------------------------------

Researching MailerLite alternatives starts with knowing what you’re looking for in an email marketing platform. Here are some essential factors to consider.

### Key features

What features matter most to you? Automation, design options, templates, CRM capabilities, [landing page](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/newsletter-landing-page) functionality? Make a wish list of the features you need to create your email newsletter. Use that list to compare the features of each MailerLite alternative. Feel free to expand your list as you test out your options; sometimes you don’t know what you don’t know.

### Scalability

As you grow, you’ll need a newsletter platform that will grow with you. Assess the scalability of each alternative and how well the platform can accommodate your business's growth. Can you easily add subscribers without incurring exorbitant costs? Does the platform [include automation](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/best-email-automation-platforms) to lighten your workload as you scale?

You might as well think best-case scenario here; if you set up your newsletter right, it’ll grow, and that’s a good problem to have.

### Ease of use

How do you like the user interface and overall user experience? A user-friendly platform can save time and resources, especially if you have team members with varying levels of technical expertise. If you’re a solo operator, it’s even more critical that the platform is user-friendly so you don’t have to spend hours learning complicated features.

### Pricing

Set a budget you’re willing to pay for a newsletter platform, and break down the pricing structures of each alternative. Consider factors such as subscription plans, pricing tiers, and any additional costs. Look for a balance between affordability and the features you need.

### Integrations

If you have an existing tech stack, analyze how well each alternative integrates with your existing tools and systems, particularly CRM solutions. Seamless integration lets you get up and running quickly, enhancing efficiency and allowing you to continue using your favorite apps and tools.

### Customer support

When you have an issue, how easy is it to reach the platform’s support team? Responsive, reliable support is crucial for addressing onboarding questions, delivering newsletters according to schedule, and preventing downtime.

### Customization options

Consider the level of customization each alternative offers. Does it allow you to personalize emails, add your logo and colors, and create visually stunning designs? The ability to tailor email campaigns to your needs and style can mean the difference between design-rich newsletters reflecting your brand and generic emails that might get left unread.

### Analytics and reporting

If you can measure it, you can improve it. Evaluate the analytics and reporting features of MailerLite alternatives to ensure access to valuable insights into campaign performance, subscriber behavior, and areas for improvement.

### User reviews

What’s the word on the street about each platform? Research user reviews and the overall reputation of each alternative for real user perspectives on the strengths and weaknesses of each platform. We’ve saved you a step by including feedback for the MailerLite alternatives below.

10 best MailerLite alternatives in 2024
---------------------------------------

The biggest factor you need to consider with any newsletter platform is whether it feels like a helpful assistant or an irritating thorn in your side. Your platform should make it easy to do what you love — create content — and not leave you bleary-eyed at 2 a.m. because you can’t figure out how to schedule your newsletter or add a call to action button.

Your best bet is to try a few options to hone in on the best newsletter platform for your needs.

Here are our top picks for the best MailerLite alternatives:

1.  [beehiiv](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#beehiiv)
2.  [ConvertKit](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#convertkit)

4.  [Brevo](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#brevo)
5.  [GetResponse](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#getresponse)
6.  [ActiveCampaign](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#activecampaign)
7.  [Flodesk](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#flodesk)
8.  [Ghost](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#ghost)
9.  [AWeber](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/mailerlite-alternatives#aweber)

### 2\. [ConvertKit](https://www.marketermilk.com/recommends/convertkit)

#### ConvertKit notable features

*   Built-in tools for monetization enable sales for digital products, with flexible pricing options for one-time payments, subscriptions, or “pay what you want.”
*   Marketing automation and reliable delivery allow you to connect with your audience and segment them for optimal return on investment.
*   Personalization tools let you engage with your audience and build brand loyalty.

Coaches, authors, podcasters, musicians, and other creators turn to ConvertKit for their newsletter needs.

### 3\. Moosend

Easily insert images, videos, and interactive elements, adding your flair or using pre-built templates. Stunning, responsive newsletters are the name of the game with Moosend, but you also get all the advanced features you need to grow and monetize your newsletter.

#### Moosend notable features

*   The integrated campaign editor lets you switch between different modes and work on different elements of your newsletter as you go.
*   A built-in image picker provides quick access to visuals to complement your message.
*   Incorporate discount codes, product recommendations, subscription forms, cart abandonment messages, and product blocks to turn subscribers into buyers.
*   Intelligent automations, automated workflows, and personalization tools keep customers engaged with your brand.

#### Moosend use cases

From startups to Fortune 500 companies, Moosend serves a broad [customer base](https://moosend.com/customers/) with clients including Vogue, Domino’s, and nonprofits such as WWF. Why? It’s a feature-rich platform with a price point that lets you start small and grow, something every newsletter creator needs.

#### Moosend pricing

After a 30-day trial, switch to a paid plan starting at $7 per month, paid annually, for up to 500 subscribers. From there, you can easily scale up according to your subscriber count.

#### Moosend reviews

**Pros:**

*   Ease of use
*   Customizations
*   Automations

**Cons:**

*   Forms feature may have limitations
*   Potential bugs and glitches
*   Slow support

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/147042/Moosend/) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/moosend/reviews#reviews).

### 4\. Brevo

![Image 7: Brevo](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6243c3bb3b5a1852803d0c7f/66f4f2a0b58ece5669b28542_65b5d38894f9ea4e4b83a0e0_brevo.jpeg)

Brevo operates on a unique pricing model, tying plans to email sending volume rather than the number of contacts in your database, enabling you to grow your contact list at no extra cost.

#### Brevo notable features

*   Landing pages and signup forms facilitate list growth.
*   Integrations and customizations let you tailor transaction emails to match your brand’s style.
*   Advanced workflows automation emails based on customer actions, personalizing the subscriber experience with timely and relevant communications.
*   Reliable delivery and campaign tracking ensure your emails reach their destinations and you can gather insights afterward.

#### Brevo use cases

Brevo supports multichannel, personalized, and mass communications for organizations around the globe. Check out the company’s [case study collection](https://www.brevo.com/success-stories/), including one French nonprofit that uses Brevo to support digitizing its fundraising efforts.

#### Brevo pricing

The free plan is loaded with features and includes up to 300 email sends daily. Paid plans start at $25 monthly for up to 20K emails monthly.

#### Brevo reviews

**Pros:**

*   Visually beautiful templates
*   Flexible pricing
*   Excellent deliverability

**Cons:**

*   Frequent service outages
*   More templates needed
*   Learning curve

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/132996/brevo/#reviews) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/brevo-transactional-email/reviews).

#### GetResponse notable features

*   Custom email and SMS marketing automation features, web pushes, and popups help you engage across channels.
*   AI-powered email generator tools facilitate rapid content creation and increased open rates.
*   Drag-and-drop functionality helps you create stunning, responsive emails effortlessly with a user-friendly editor.
*   Over 200 customizable templates suit various campaign goals and occasions.

#### GetResponse use cases

A welcome email series with a 54% sales rate, revenue of $1K for every 1,000 emails sent, and 2x more conversions from an abandoned cart email — these are just a few GetResponse success stories. The platform boasts an average list growth of 100% for all paid plans in the first 30 days. Read [more success stories here](https://www.getresponse.com/customers).

#### GetResponse pricing

#### GetResponse reviews

**Pros:**

*   Advanced segmentation and testing
*   Additional tools for building landing pages, webinars, and funnels
*   Helpful tutorials to get up and running

**Cons:**

*   Confusing dashboard
*   Limited integrations

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/153948/GetResponse/#reviews) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/getresponse/reviews).

### 6\. ActiveCampaign

![Image 9: ActiveCampaign](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6243c3bb3b5a1852803d0c7f/66f4f2a1b58ece5669b28732_65b5d3dc27beaa7124d864be_activecampaign.jpeg)

From email marketing to sales engagement and CRM, [ActiveCampaign](https://www.activecampaign.com/feature/email-marketing) provides a suite of tools for creating personalized, targeted campaigns. The platform offers a user-friendly drag-and-drop email designer, over 250 templates, and tools for segmentation and dynamic content. Robust analytics and A/B testing help optimize email performance, keeping you on track with your newsletter goals.

#### ActiveCampaign notable features

*   Mobile optimization ensures your content appears responsively on any device.
*   Multi-user editing allows for collaborative campaigns.
*   Reporting tools reveal what’s working and what’s not, while split testing and segmentation allow you to improve future campaigns.
*   From payment processors to membership websites and ecommerce platforms, ActiveCampaign integrates with various tools in your tech stack.

#### ActiveCampaign use cases

ActiveCampaign shines in automation and segmentation, with deep logic that allows you to send targeted email sequences. Anyone needing to reach audiences at different stages in the funnel may find ActiveCampaign useful. From increasing sales to personalizing campaigns, ActiveCampaign’s [success stories](https://www.activecampaign.com/customers) speak for themselves.

#### ActiveCampaign pricing

After a free trial, plans start at $29 monthly, paid annually, for up to 1,000 contacts.

#### ActiveCampaign reviews

**Pros:**

*   Deliverability
*   Integrations
*   Automation platform

**Cons:**

*   Pricier compared to other options
*   Learning curve
*   Editor and templates need improvement, especially if you’re creating a newsletter

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/79367/ActiveCampaign/) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/activecampaign-for-marketing/reviews).

### 7\. Flodesk

![Image 10: Flodesk](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6243c3bb3b5a1852803d0c7f/66f4f2a1b58ece5669b2873b_65b5d409b903d723b108d436_flodesk.jpeg)

Ideal for beginners and pro creators alike, [Flodesk](https://flodesk.com/) offers an intuitive email builder and attractive templates with customization and sharing options. Whether or not you have a website, Flodesk empowers you to grow your email list with visually stunning emails, transforming subscribers into sales.

#### Flodesk notable features

*   Enjoy unlimited subscribers even on the free plan, with ecommerce, email marketing, and forms functionality available with paid plans. Great for transactional emails.
*   Flat-rate pricing means you won’t need to upgrade if you add more subscribers or send more emails.
*   Unlike many checkout tools, Flodesk does not impose platform fees, allowing you to retain 100% of your revenue, with only the Stripe processing fee applied.
*   Flodesk lets you create on your timeline, only paying when you’re ready to publish.

#### Flodesk use cases

Great for newsletter creation for ecommerce businesses, Flodesk allows you to “design emails people love to get.” Here’s a [success story](https://flodesk.com/blog/how-this-lifestyle-brand-achieved-three-sold-out-launches-with-flodesk/) on how one lifestyle brand achieved three sold-out launches worth a read, and you can check out the Flodesk blog for more.

#### Flodesk pricing

Start with a free plan that includes unlimited subscribers. Paid plans with more capabilities are $35 per month, billed annually, with the option to add ecommerce functionality at $24 monthly.

#### Flodesk reviews

**Pros:**

*   Flat-rate pricing and unlimited emails
*   Modern templates
*   No extra cost for adding subscribers

**Cons:**

*   Analytics could be better
*   Inability to set payment currency for checkout
*   Some users report poor customer support

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/207268/Flodesk/#reviews) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/flodesk/reviews).

### 8\. Ghost

![Image 11: Ghost CMS](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6243c3bb3b5a1852803d0c7f/66f4f2a1b58ece5669b28738_65b5d434dd9c39ddd2677446_ghost-cms.jpeg)

Designed for modern publishing, [Ghost](https://ghost.org/) empowers creators to build, share, and grow their business with ease. The app is open-source and investor-free, giving publishers complete control over website design, advanced creator tools for web and email newsletters, and audience growth features.

#### Ghost notable features

*   Ghost is a creator-first email marketing solution, incorporating website creation, newsletters, memberships, and payment processing.
*   The Ghost editor offers an editing workflow for various content types, including writing, photography, videos, podcasts, and more, allowing creators to easily compose and publish diverse content.
*   Retain all content rights and have access to 100% of your data.
*   Premium tiers with 0% fees enable creators to publish private content for paying members and generate revenue without losing a percentage to payment fees.

#### Ghost use cases

Creators, publishers such as media outlets, businesses, and developers looking for an all-in-one platform use Ghost. The platform combines website development, email newsletters, payment processing, private content publishing, and other publishing tools. Explore [creators using Ghost here](https://ghost.org/explore/).

#### Ghost pricing

Get started for free; paid plans start at $9 monthly, paid annually, for up to 500 members.

#### Ghost reviews

**Pros:**

*   Robust content editor built for writers
*   All-in-one platform
*   Free and premium themes

**Cons:**

*   Can get pricey once you start to grow beyond 500 members
*   Analytics may be too basic
*   May be tricky for non-coders if you want more customizations

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/151947/Ghost/) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/ghost/reviews#reviews).

### 9\. AWeber

![Image 12: AWeber](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6243c3bb3b5a1852803d0c7f/66f4f2a1b58ece5669b28744_65b5d48927beaa7124d8e65e_aweber.jpeg)

[AWeber](https://www.aweber.com/), a pioneer in small-business email marketing since 1998, is a user-friendly email marketing software with over 1 million customers globally. The platform empowers users to build responsive landing pages, manage contacts, and send impactful emails without technical expertise.

#### AWeber notable features

*   The platform collaborates with over 1,000 partner software solutions, ensuring smooth integration with your favorite apps.
*   Save time using pre-built autoresponders, custom sign-up forms, and landing pages, all designed to grow your email list.
*   Access reports to understand performance, A/B split test for optimization, and enhance deliverability without expert knowledge.
*   Ensure your emails reach recipients' inboxes with reliable deliverability.

#### AWeber use cases

The email-forward platform is built for email marketing and automation, helping creators, solo entrepreneurs, and small businesses grow their subscriber lists with email marketing campaigns. One user launched a virtual product during the pandemic using AWeber’s landing page builder to save her wine-tour business; another used AWeber’s automation tools to grow affiliate income. Read [more success stories here](https://www.aweber.com/successstories.htm).

#### AWeber pricing

Get started for free; paid plans start at $12.50 per month, billed annually.

#### AWeber reviews

**Pros:**

*   Free forever plan with no credit card required for sign-up
*   User-friendly interface
*   Templates, workflows, and automations with triggers

**Cons:**

*   Lack of native photo editing tools
*   Visual appeal is underwhelming
*   Landing pages and forms may be cumbersome to set up and integrate

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/95949/AWeber-Email-Marketing/) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/aweber/reviews).

### 10\. Customer.io

![Image 13: Customer.io](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6243c3bb3b5a1852803d0c7f/66f4f2a1b58ece5669b28741_65b5d493dd9c39ddd267af90_customer-io.jpeg)

[Customer.io](https://customer.io/) is a customer engagement platform catering to marketing teams, enabling the creation of data-driven campaigns across various messaging channels. Its product suite includes Journeys, an automation tool for comprehensive engagement, and Data Pipelines, a customer data platform linking your entire tech stack. Great for [SaaS companies](https://www.marketermilk.com/blog/saas-companies).

#### Customer.io notable features

*   Automate and personalize marketing messages for specific customer groups with targeted offers and messages.
*   Connect with customers how they want to be reached, leveraging the communication channels they use the most.
*   Collect and route data to all your tools, linking first-party data seamlessly and syncing with popular platforms like Google Ads and Facebook Ads.
*   A visual workflow build helps you build campaigns visually, integrating automated or API-triggered workflows, broadcasts, and transactional messages.

#### Customer.io use cases

The platform is “for tech companies that want to build trust,” with customers such as Notion, Guardio, and Spotahome. Wedio uses Customer.io to increase revenue by 25%; Mailgun boosted its customer onboarding rate by 30%. Read [more success stories here](https://customer.io/customers/).

#### Customer.io pricing

The Essentials plan starts at $100 monthly.

#### Customer.io reviews

**Pros:**

*   Automations and workflows
*   Abundant integrations
*   Excels in campaign creation and management

**Cons:**

*   One of the priciest options on our list
*   Might not be suitable for independent creators
*   Analytics may be lacking

Read more at [Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/p/174023/Customer-io/) and [G2](https://www.g2.com/products/customer-io/reviews).

What is the best MailerLite alternative?
----------------------------------------

Thanks to its suite of creator-friendly tools that simplify every aspect of newsletter management, beehiiv is the clear winner in our book when it comes to MailerLite alternatives.

If you want to launch a newsletter affordably and easily, monetize it, ensure it gets delivered, and share it with the world, beehiiv should be your go-to email marketing tool.
